November 10, 2000 - November 23, 2000



ping.....pong:


... ripping off the register...

...The author of the enormously popular freeware network tool PING, Mike Muuss, died in a Maryland car crash last night. The accident happened at 9.30pm (New York time) on route 95 as a result of a previous accident. Mike hit a car stuck in the middle of the road and was pushed into the path of an oncoming tractor.

Mike Muuss was a highly respected senior scientist at the US Army Research Lab in Maryland and specialised in geometric modelling, virtual reality, MIMD architectures, digital networks and OSes. He was well known to the Internet community - always helpful and knowledgeable (and frequently witty) about his subject and will be sorely missed. He wrote a number of software packages and network tools but PING is the one he'll be most remembered for...

:/

November 23jokerbone

late night aimbots:


The other night we had evan start a quick server for some tourneys because we were trying to get demo's of our own tgm2000 playing under the influence :)

Instead, we got only a bit of him blathering about stuff and a real demo of agamemnon playing against an aimbot (evan started the server in a hurry, didn't set it to pure and set no password)

It's neat to watch and unmistakable.. unfortunately the guy was a choad so we gave him the boot. Then mark came in and ruined our "drunken b demo" by wanting to 2v2.

What a jackass.
:D

November 20Thrash

demoscript:


Our hacking buddies in the houseofshadows, creators of the notorious meawping, have quickly whipped up yet another handy script. Rather than try to describe it myself, i'll just rip this from their homepage:

A demo playback script - A little q3 script I wrote for watching demos and getting screenshots.  Binds for turning on/off the HUD, toggling 3rd person, pausing, fast forward/slowmo, and panning the camera in 3rd person. There's a mini-readme at the top of the file.
- shadow'riffington

Just peeped this article over at gamasutra.com that discusses cheating in multiplayer online gaming with somewhat of a focus on the fps genre we all love so dearly. It's a long read but covers the ways a hack can be perpetrated and how to stop them..

good "i should be in class right now" reading if i may say so...

3dfx:


For those of you that haven't heard, 3dfx is no longer making video cards. They are going back to their roots of just making chips. Sad to see them go but not as sad as I am when I play Q3 with my voodoo3. Bring on the power nVidia!

November 14jokerbone

rune?:


Rune seems to be the most popular game in the q3 community since q3 came out. It's pretty, it's challenging, and of course - it has a deathmatch mode.

I gave it a whirl, then i heard my roomate watching a Simpsons re-run on fox and and realised how valuable a commodity "time" is and went to watch it with him.

This is one of those games where the average player on a server is pinging 300 because a: the netcode sucks and b: the average player is a PCGamer reader that doesn't know what ping is.

If I wanted to search for important things in stupid places it'd be a lot more fun to just let my roomate take my keys to get the mail and wait a few hours before asking for them back.

This review at OldManMurray is a must read.

November 13jokerbone

life_stages.txt.shs:


Lately there have been some problems with this virus on etg; people are getting banned, machines are crashing ect ect. Basically this virus shows up in your mirc dl folder as a text file, or so it would appear. I'm not offering any fixes for this virus if you open it you're going to have to deal with it, but with slight change in the registry this file would no longer appear to be just another txt file, but rather the .shs file that it really is. I would suggest that all of those concerned about this virus make this change in the registry. Always backup before making changes blah blah you know the drill, lets get to the details.


HKEY_CLASSES_ROOT\ShellScrap
"NeverShowExt"="0"

All you have to do is change the "NeverShowExt" entry to "AlwaysShowExt" then reboot. Simple as that, whether you want to open this .shs file is up to you, but at least you'll recognize it for what it is. For more details on this virus including the registry change visit this website.

http://vil.mcafee.com/dispVirus.asp?virus_k=98668&


(to rip a link from them - if you _do_ have it, use this fix asap) - jokerbone

November 12agamemnon

jokerbone?:


The Clown put his hands in his pockets, and after puffing out
his cheeks and nodding his head at them saucily, he said:


"My lady fair,
Why do you stare
At poor old Mr. Joker?
You're quite as stiff
And prim as if
You'd eaten up a poker!"


"Be quiet, sir!" said the Princess. "Can't you see these are
strangers, and should be treated with respect?"

"Well, that's respect, I expect," declared the Clown,
and immediately stood upon his head.

"Don't mind Mr. Joker," said the Princess to Dorothy. "He is
considerably cracked in his head, and that makes him foolish."


(ty freaky-frank-l-baum, tyvm)
